item.title: Agatha Christie's Miss Marple Series 4 Episode 1 A Pocket Full Of Rye
item.description: When Miss Marple learns of the deaths of businessman Rex Fortescue, his young wife Adele and their housemaid Gladys she has a very personal reason to investigate. CAST: Julia McKenzie, Matthew MacFadyen

item.title: Visions Of The Future Epsiode 2 : The Biotech Revolution
item.description: Physicist Michio Kaku believes that humankind is witnessing a bio-molecular revolution that promises the almost godlike ability to manipulate life at the most fundamental level.

item.title: Visions Of The Future Episode 1 Intelligence Revolution
item.description: What will life in the future be like? American theoretical physicist Michio Kaku believes humankind is on the brink of a radically new scientific era. In this 3-part series, he shares his vision for the future.

item.title: Lateline 03/11/11
item.description: Lateline is a unique nightly news analysis program bringing you up-to-the-minute coverage of Australian and international news and events.

item.title: Lateline 02/11/11
item.description: Lateline is a unique nightly news analysis program bringing you up-to-the-minute coverage of Australian and international news and events.

item.title: Lateline 01/11/11
item.description: Lateline is a unique nightly news analysis program bringing you up-to-the-minute coverage of Australian and international news and events.

item.title: Lateline 31/10/11
item.description: Lateline is a unique nightly news analysis program bringing you up-to-the-minute coverage of Australian and international news and events.

item.title: Lateline 28/10/11
item.description: Ali Moore presents stories on the opening of CHOGM; the Qantas AGM; James Packer defending comments that his empire is built on gambling addicts; Bangkok floods; and a round the world yacht race; plus an interview with writer and historian, Paul Ham.

item.title: Lateline 27/10/11
item.description: Tony Jones presents stories on the Eurozone debt deal including an interview with Professor Yanis Varoufakis from Athens University; the Malaysian PM arriving for CHOGM; West Papua's independence movement; and the re-opening of the Bolshoi Theatre.

item.title: Lateline 26/10/11
item.description: Tony Jones presents stories on Tony Abbott's opposition to poker machine legislation, including an interview with Andrew Wilkie; the suicide of a Sri Lankan refugee in detention; floods in Bangkok; and an emergency meeting of European leaders.

item.title: Lateline 25/10/11
item.description: Ali Moore presents stories on CHOGM; Malcolm Fraser's calls for Sri Lanka to address war crimes; the burial of Gaddafi; the Turkish earthquake; the Tunisian election; and an interview with Alistair Darling, former British Chancellor of the Exchequer.

item.title: Lateline 24/10/11
item.description: Ali Moore presents this edition which features stories about war crimes charges against the Sri Lankan president; an earthquake in Turkey; the liberation of Libya; a free election in Tunisia; and China looking at the lack of compassion in its society after the death of a toddler, including an interview with Geremie Barme.

item.title: Lateline 21/10/11
item.description: Ali Moore hosts this edition which features stories on the death of Muammar Gaddafi, including an interview with Libyan ambassador to the US, Ali Aujali; "Occupy Melbourne" protests; new rules for live exports; and News Corps AGM, including an interview with Tom Watson.

item.title: Lateline Business 03/11/2011
item.description: Lateline Business is a comprehensive look at the financial and economic news of the day. The program has feature interviews with business leaders, as well as updates on stockmarkets here and abroad.

item.title: Lateline Business 02/11/2011
item.description: Lateline Business is a comprehensive look at the financial and economic news of the day. The program has feature interviews with business leaders, as well as updates on stockmarkets here and abroad.

item.title: Lateline Business 01/11/2011
item.description: Lateline Business is a comprehensive look at the financial and economic news of the day. The program has feature interviews with business leaders, as well as updates on stockmarkets here and abroad.

item.title: Lateline Business 31/10/2011
item.description: Lateline Business is a comprehensive look at the financial and economic news of the day. The program has feature interviews with business leaders, as well as updates on stockmarkets here and abroad.

item.title: Lateline Business 27/10/2011
item.description: Lateline Business is a comprehensive look at the financial and economic news of the day. The program has feature interviews with business leaders, as well as updates on stockmarkets here and abroad.

item.description: Lateline Business is a comprehensive look at the financial and economic news of the day. The program has feature interviews with business leaders, as well as updates on stockmarkets here and abroad.

item.description: Lateline Business is a comprehensive look at the financial and economic news of the day. The program has feature interviews with business leaders, as well as updates on stockmarkets here and abroad.

item.title: Lateline Business 24/10/2011
item.description: Lateline Business is a comprehensive look at the financial and economic news of the day. The program has feature interviews with business leaders, as well as updates on stockmarkets here and abroad.

item.title: Crownies Episode 18
item.description: Janet King and Lina Badir put aside their differences as they face the first day of the Max Gardiner trial. CAST: Marta Dusseldorp, Andea Demetriades, Nicholas Bakopoulis-Cooke

item.title: Crownies Episode 17
item.description: Richard finds himself handling a trial at the last minute with only thirty hours to prepare. But after working all night his exhaustion makes him deal awkwardly and carelessly with the victim's family. CAST: Hamish Michael

item.title: Crownies Episode 16
item.description: Janet and Lina face a setback in the Gardiner case; Lina decides she and Andy should make their relationship public; and Ben is stymied in a child murder case. CAST: Marta Dusseldorp, Andrea Demetriades, Sacha Horler

item.title: Crownies Episode 15
item.description: Ben and Tony work together to try to sort out the legal complexities of an exorcism case; while Erin agrees to a blind date with Conrad's carpenter friend from the gym. CAST: Todd Lasance, Peter Kowitz, Ella Scott Lynch

item.title: The Slap Episode 5 Rosie
item.description: Rosie receives notification of the court date. Finally Harry will be punished for what he did. But her relief is short lived when she realises she is alone in her crusade. CAST: Melissa George, Alex Dimitriades

item.title: The Slap Episode 4 Connie
item.description: When Hector tells Connie that he regrets their affair, she tells Richie that Hector raped her. After finding a new love interest she is oblivious to the trouble her lie has created. CAST: Jonathan LaPaglia, Sophie Lowe

item.title: The Slap Episode 3 Harry
item.description: Harry has everything; the Brighton Beach mansion, the beautiful wife, a son and a successful business. But Harry stands to lose all of that as a result of slapping Hugo. CAST: Alex Dimitriades, Melissa George, Diana Glenn

item.title: The Slap Episode 2 Anouk
item.description: Anouk's life is full of pressures - her mother is ill, she's losing control at work, and learns she is pregnant with her much younger boyfriend's baby. CAST: Melissa George, Essie Davis, Alex Dimitriades, Jonathan LaPaglia

item.title: The Slap Episode 1 Hector
item.description: An 8-part drama series that traces the shattering repercussions of a single event upon a group of family and friends. CAST: Jonathan LaPaglia, Melissa George, Alex Dimitriades, Sophie Okonedo, Essie Davis

item.title: QI Series 9 Episode 13 Holidays
item.description: The mood is relaxed for this 'Holiday' themed episode. Joining QI Master Stephen Fry are panellists Rob Brydon, Bill Bailey, Rich Hall and Alan Davies.

item.title: QI Series 9 Episode 12 Horsey
item.description: Tally-ho! This episode is all about 'Horses and Hunting'. Joining QI Master Stephen Fry are panellists Jimmy Carr, Dara O'Briain, Clare Balding and Alan Davies.

item.title: Mastercrafts Episode 5 Weaving
item.description: Monty Don enters the colourful world of the handloom weaver. Under his watchful eye, three hopefuls who are passionate about learning weaving are put through their paces by the leading practitioners of this craft.

item.title: Mastercrafts Episode 4 Stained Glass
item.description: Presenter Monty Don puts three more passionate beginners through their paces as they follow their dreams of learning the ancient craft of stained glass.

item.title: Baroque Episode 2
item.description: Waldemar Januszczak continues his trail across Europe in search of Baroque, this week he is in Spain, featuring Velasquez and Caravaggio, then on to Belgium and Holland as we discover Rubens, Rembrandt and Vermeer.

item.title: Baroque Episode 1
item.description: Three-part series exploring the Baroque tradition in art and architecture, around the world. Opening the series UK art critic Waldemar Januszczak begins his search in Rome, where Baroque began.

item.title: At The Movies Series 7 Episode 39
item.description: Margaret and David review: In Time; Our Idiot Brother; Anonymous; Autoluminescent; Don't Be Afraid Of The Dark, and Margaret reviews DVD Classic: Notorious. Also, a short review of the Brisbane International Film Festival.

item.title: At The Movies Series 7 Episode 38 25 Years Of Margaret And David
item.description: Cate Blanchett and Geoffrey Rush host a very special episode in front of a live studio audience of invited guests to celebrate Margaret and David's 25 years together on television.
7.30 is the ABC's national flagship current affairs program, led by two of Australia's most respected journalists - Leigh Sales and Chris Uhlmann.
7.30 is the ABC's national flagship current affairs program, led by two of Australia's most respected journalists - Leigh Sales and Chris Uhlmann.

item.title: The Hamster Wheel Episode 5
item.description: The Chaser team's take on the media and events of the week.

item.title: The Hamster Wheel Episode 4
item.description: The Chaser team's take on the media and events of the week.

item.title: The Hamster Wheel Episode 3
item.description: The Chaser team's take on the media and events of the week.

item.title: The Hamster Wheel Episode 2
item.description: The Chaser team's take on the media and events of the week.

item.title: The Hamster Wheel Episode 1
item.description: The Chaser team's take on the media and events of the week.

item.title: Spicks And Specks Series 7 Episode 26
item.description: Adam, Alan and Myf are joined by musical comedian Scott Edgar, American soprano Takesha Meshe-Kizart, funny favourite Denise Scott, and Red Symons. Boogie Woogie piano player Jan Preston closes the show.

item.title: Spicks And Specks Series 7 Episode 25
item.description: Joining Adam, Alan and Myf are Kram from Spiderbait, musical comedian Josh Earl, opera director Hugh Halliday, and show favourite Dave O'Neil.

item.title: Poh's Kitchen On The Road Series 2 Episode 11
item.description: Poh is in WA's remote East Kimberley - cattle country. She has always dreamt of having the full-on outback cattle experience and at Home Valley Station all her dreams come true. She also discovers the wonders of the Boab.

item.title: Poh's Kitchen On The Road Series 2 Episode 10
item.description: Poh is on the road in Melbourne to find out why this city takes its coffee so seriously. So many factors have influenced the growth of Australia's coffee culture and Poh finds its all on show here in Melbourne's back streets.

item.title: Gruen Planet Episode 6
item.description: Gruen Planet turns its attention back on Qantas and asks how it will rebuild its brand internationally and at home after its weekend stoppage. Also, the marketing around Occupy Wall Street protests.

item.title: Gruen Planet Episode 5
item.description: This week Gruen Planet looks at the Spring carnival and all things horsey; The Pitch attempts to convince Australians not to bet on the Melbourne Cup and The Image Renovators discuss Hungry Jack's re-branding strategies.

item.title: Country House Rescue Series 2 Episode 3
item.description: Following on from the highly successful first series, Ruth Watson (The Hotel Inspector) returns to help restore once great country houses to their former glory. Each of the houses and its owners need to diversify or face the prospect of going into debt, selling or handing over the keys to investors.

item.title: Country House Rescue Series 2 Episode 2
item.description: Ruth is in Kent helping four generations of the Rogers family bring Riverhill Manor - an 18th century manor set in 130 acres of historic gardens - back to its former splendour.

item.title: Big Ideas Series 4 Episode 76
item.description: The amazing monologist and actor, Mike Daisy, argues that 'Collaborating with Corporations Sells out the Human Race' in a special Festival of Dangerous Ideas event.

item.title: Big Ideas Series 4 Episode 75
item.description: Slovenian philosopher, Slavoj Zizek, on revamping Communism; a special IQ2 Debate 'The Media Has No Morals'; Mike Daisy argues that 'Collaborating with Corporations Sells out the Human Race'; and more.

item.title: Big Ideas Series 4 The Andrew Olle Lecture 2011
item.description: Laurie Oakes draws on some 47 years of media experience when presenting this year's Andrew Olle Media Lecture, established in 1996 in memory of ABC Radio broadcaster Andrew Olle.

item.title: First Tuesday Book Club Series 5 Episode 9
item.description: Jennifer is joined on the book club by Jon Ronson and Julia Baird to discuss the Pulitzer prize winner, 'A Visit from the Goon Squad' by Jennifer Egan and Oscar Wilde's short story 'The Happy Prince'.

item.title: Foreign Correspondent 1/11/2011
item.description: Nine months ago Egyptians were celebrating their revolution and savouring their victory, after a mass protest finally brought about the end of President Mubarak's 30-year dictatorship. But was it really a victory or has the revolution been hijacked?

item.title: Foreign Correspondent 25/10/2011
item.description: With their country finally liberated fromn the Gaddafi regime, thousands of Libyans who fled decades ago in fear of their lives are at last free to come home. We accompany the prominent opposition figure Mansour el Kikhia on his emotional journey from the United States.

item.title: Foreign Correspondent 18/10/2011
item.description: Mormonism is making it big in mainstream America, with a hit Broadway musical, two TV series featuring polygamous families, an advertising campaign and two Mormon candidates running for the Republican Presidential nomination. But can popularity at the box office translate into success in the ballot box?

item.title: Rome Wasn't Built In A Day Episode 5
item.description: Plastering more than 3000sq meters of internal walls proves a huge challenge for the single plasterer in the work gang, recreating the Roman villa. And the hypocaust heating its bathhouse floor is not performing.

item.title: Rome Wasn't Built In A Day Episode 4
item.description: The project to build a Roman villa using only ancient tools and methods, is at halfway point. Artistic endeavours can take over from the functional for a while, bringing the workmen unusual pleasure.

item.title: Lost Gardens Episode 8 Penjerrick
item.description: Presenter Monty Don, garden historian Dr Toby Musgrave and landscaper Ann-Marie Powell discover a tropical paradise near Falmouth in Cornwall.

item.title: Lost Gardens Episode 7 Chatham
item.description: By piecing together evidence from the ground, archives and from a detailed model of the Chatham Historical Dockyard dated 1774, the team is able to attempt one of the only accurate Georgian town garden restorations.

item.title: Australian Story 31/10/2011 : Something About Me
item.description: Kristina Keneally's dramatic and controversial rise through the ranks of the Labor Party has been well documented. Born and raised in America, she made history by becoming the first female Premier of NSW. Kristina tells her story.

item.title: Australian Story 24/10/2011 : Bad Blood: Part 2
item.description: The baffling case of Jeffrey Gilham continues. He is currently serving a life sentence for the murders of his own parents in Sydney nearly twenty years ago.

item.title: Australian Story 17/10/11
item.description: Bad Blood: This week's Australian Story program is the first of a two-parter on the notorious case of Jeffrey Gilham, in jail for life for the murders of his own parents.

item.title: Australian Story 10/10/11
item.description: Under Her Spell: This week's program tells the story of the Australian woman at the heart of Steven Spielberg's much anticipated Christmas blockbuster.

item.title: Australian Story 03/10/11
item.description: For the Holy Grail: This week we revisit the story of two Australian scientists and their quest for one of medicine's holy grails finding a way to treat cancer without the dreaded side effects.

item.title: Meerkat Manor Series 3 Episode 12 The Graduate
item.description: While young Wilson from the Commandos introduces himself to a particular Whiskers lady, someone else makes a surprise return. And there's hope for lone female Mozart when a dashing young male turns his attentions to her.

item.title: Meerkat Manor Series 3 Episode 11 Three Degrees Of Separation
item.description: The wide-eyed Whiskers' pups are taken out on a foraging trip. Meanwhile Mozart, Kinkajou and De la Soul have fallen on hard times. They bravely go in search of a solution, but they end up looking in all the wrong places.

item.title: Behind The News BtN 25/10/11
item.description: Behind the News is a high-energy fun way for upper primary and secondary students to learn about current issues and events in their world.

item.title: The Prisoner Episode 6 Check Mate (Final)
item.description: Six has a strange and inexplicable disease that will end his life unless he agrees to assimilate to Village life. CAST: Sir Ian McKellen, Jim Caviezel, Jamie Campbell Bower, Rachel Blake

item.title: The Prisoner Episode 5 Schizoid
item.description: Six's memory from his 'real life' is becoming clearer as his treacherous relationship with Two becomes even more strained. CAST: Ruth Wilson, Sir Ian McKellen

item.title: The Darling Buds Of May Episode 4 When The Green Woods Laugh : Part Two
item.description: Mariette prepares for her marriage to Charlie, the reformed Tax Inspector. Meanwhile, Pop turns his hand to property developing. CAST: David Jason, Catherine Zeta Jones, Pam Ferris

item.title: The Darling Buds Of May Episode 3 When The Green Woods Laugh : Part One
item.description: Mariette prepares for her marriage to Charlie, the reformed Tax Inspector. Meanwhile, Pop turns his hand to property developing. CAST: David Jason, Catherine Zeta Jones, Pam Ferris

item.title: Four Corners 31/10/11
item.description: Trial and Error? - An investigation that delves into one of Australia's longest running and most controversial murder cases.

item.title: Four Corners 24/10/11 : Asylum
item.description: Asylum: A story that reveals what's really going on inside Australia's immigration detention centres and how the treatment of detainees has the potential to create a generation of people with major mental health problems.

item.title: Four Corners 10/10/11 : Sex Slavery
item.description: Sex Slavery: A story that goes inside the world of human trafficking, debt bondage and sexual servitude; a world where women are bought and sold, traded like commodities and literally enslaved.

item.title: Psychoville Halloween Special
item.description: It's Halloween and the spirits are gathering at Ravenhill Psychiatric Hospital where TV researcher Phil from 'Dales Overnight Ghost Hunts' is about to have a night he will never forget. CAST: Eileen Atkins

item.title: Q&A Series 4 Episode 38
item.description: Host Tony Jones is joined by: Outgoing Ombudsman, Allan Asher; Conductor, Richard Gill; Author, Anne Summers; Psychiatrist and Commentator, Tanveer Ahmed; and The Australian's, Rebecca Weisser.

item.title: Q&A Series 4 Episode 37
item.description: Host Tony Jones is joined by: MP, Christopher Pyne; Former MP, Graham Richardson; Economist, Judith Sloan; Singer, Kate Miller-Heidke; MP, Tanya Plibersek; and Filmmaker John Waters

item.title: Media Watch 2011 Episode 38
item.description: Australia's leading forum for media analysis and comment, presented by Jonathan Holmes.

item.title: Media Watch 2011 Episode 37
item.description: Australia's leading forum for media analysis and comment, presented by Jonathan Holmes.

item.title: Outnumbered Series 2 Episode 4
item.description: Pete and Sue find themselves in every parent's nightmare - trapped in a foreign airport with three bored young children. CAST: Claire Skinner

item.title: Outnumbered Series 2 Episode 3
item.description: Mum and Dad attempt to ban TV and try to spend a Sunday playing good old fashioned parlour games instead. CAST: Claire Skinner

item.title: Time Team America Episode 5 Fort James, South Dakota
item.description: Final Episode. The team search for a stone fortress built by the U.S. Cavalry to protect frontier settlers in the Wild West.

item.title: Time Team America Episode 4 Range Creek
item.description: Time Team America heads to the picturesque and remote canyons of southern Utah to examine what remains of the Fremont Indians who lived there 1,000 years ago.

item.title: Prokofiev: The Unfinished Diary
item.description: The Russian composer and pianist Prokofiev kept exhaustive diaries throughout his life. This documentary examines those he wrote while he was in self-imposed exile from 1918-1935, in the USA, France and elsewhere.

item.title: Backyard Science Episode 7
item.description: No Bunsen burners or laboratories here, this is science for everybody, anywhere. Wherever the kids want to take it; in the garden, in the kitchen or in the shed, this is science BY kids FOR kids!

item.title: Backyard Science Episode 6
item.description: No Bunsen burners or laboratories here, this is science for everybody, anywhere. Wherever the kids want to take it; in the garden, in the kitchen or in the shed, this is science BY kids FOR kids!

item.title: Backyard Science Episode 5
item.description: No Bunsen burners or laboratories here, this is science for everybody, anywhere. Wherever the kids want to take it; in the garden, in the kitchen or in the shed, this is science BY kids FOR kids!

item.title: Backyard Science Episode 4
item.description: No Bunsen burners or laboratories here, this is science for everybody, anywhere. Wherever the kids want to take it; in the garden, in the kitchen or in the shed, this is science BY kids FOR kids!

item.title: Ladies Of Letters Episode 4
item.description: Vera discovers her unmarried daughter Karen is pregnant! Irene pays Vera a visit and finds that she gets on very well with Karen, who decides to spend a few days with her mum's pen pal.

item.title: Ladies Of Letters Episode 3
item.description: Irene invites Vera to stay for a few days. They attend the annual cricket club dance, where Irene has been given the honour of presenting a special prize, but Irene is shocked and disgusted when Vera 'hogs the limelight'.

item.title: Pride And Prejudice Series 2 Episode 1
item.description: News reaches the Bennet household of the arrival of the financially well-off Mr. Bingley. There's less enthusiasm for his friend Mr. Darcy who comes to regret his slighting of Lizzie's 'country' ways. CAST: Colin Firth

item.title: Compass Series 25 Episode 38 Life's Big Questions: Lincoln Hall
item.description: Scott Stephens meets Mt Everest conqueror and survivor, Lincoln Hall and talks to him about his beliefs, life, death and miracles.

item.title: Compass Series 25 Episode 37 Life's Big Questions: Cheryl Kernot
item.description: Scott Stephens's guest was briefly Australia's most popular political leader before her downfall. Cheryl Kernot talks to Scott about Christian values, hypocrisy, betrayal and love.

item.title: Compass Series 25 Episode 36 Life's Big Questions: Peter Cundall
item.description: Scott Stephens returns to continue the search for meaning. First up is Peter Cundall, the irrepressible face of gardening in Australia. He's packed many lives into his 84 years. So, does he believe in God?

item.title: Grumpy Guide To... Series 2 Episode 5 Romance (Final)
item.description: For grumpy people things that are supposed to make us universally, unreservedly happy have a habit of making us very grumpy indeed - just like the topic 'romance'.

item.title: Grumpy Guide To... Series 2 Episode 4 Money
item.description: Our Grumpies are hot under the collar about money. They can't stand all those people in diamonds and silly fast cars showing off and the lid is lifted on the baffling world of finance.

item.title: The No.1 Ladies' Detective Agency Episode 6 Beauty And Integrity
item.description: A rival detective agency sets up in competition to the No 1 Ladies and a beauty pageant promoter asks Precious to vet the contestants in his 'Beauty and Integrity' contest. CAST: Jill Scott

item.title: The No.1 Ladies' Detective Agency Episode 5 Problems In Moral Philosophy
item.description: Precious is asked to help in the case of a woman who suspects her husband has bought a stolen car and she wants to return it so she can be "right with the Lord". CAST: Jill Scott

item.title: Fake or Fortune? Episode 3 Van Meergeren
item.description: Journalist Fiona Bruce teams up with art expert Philip Mould to investigate mysteries behind paintings. The duo investigates a painting by the world's most famous forgers - Han Van Meegeren.

item.title: Fake or Fortune? Episode 2 Homer
item.description: Journalist Fiona Bruce teams up with art expert Philip Mould to investigate mysteries behind paintings. The duo investigates a painting, by the famous American artist Homer, that was found near a rubbish tip.

item.title: Wide Open Road Episode 3 Car Wars
item.description: Australia's love of cars provoked major conflicts in society: between the inner cities and the suburbs, the drinking drivers versus the police, the local industry versus the international world, the petrol car and the future.

item.title: Wide Open Road Episode 2 Dream Machines
item.description: Cars quickly became integral to every aspect of our lives. By the end of the 1950s most parents experienced the world through the windscreen and most kids watched it go by from the back seat upon which many of them were spawned.

item.title: Wide Open Road Episode 1 Here Come The Petrol Heads
item.description: Throughout the 20th century the car has been tangled up in the social, political and economic fabric of Australia. It conquered the interior, shaped the design of our cities and created some of our best-loved heroes.

item.title: Life Episode 6 Insects
item.description: Take to the skies with millions of monarch butterflies; see a beetle spray boiling chemicals at its enemies; witness giant bees fight to the death over females; join the marching columns of grass cutter ants; and more.

item.title: Art Nation Series 2 Episode 36
item.description: With a nod to 80s music, fashion and art, Aviary is a new ballet that compares the movements of birds with those of the flamboyant, human dandy.

item.title: Art of Germany Episode 3 In The Shadow Of Hitler (Final)
item.description: Andrew Graham-Dixon concludes his exploration of German art by investigating the dark and difficult times of the 20th century.

item.title: Art of Germany Episode 2 Dream And Machine
item.description: Andrew Graham-Dixon continues his exploration of German art by looking at the tumultuous 19th century and early 20th century, and how artists were at the forefront of Germany's drive to become a single nation.

item.title: Message Stick Series 13 Episode 20 In The Frame: Rebecca Richards
item.description: Rebecca Richards is a shy and unassuming Adnyamathanha and Barngarl woman from the Flinders Ranges, SA. But don't be fooled! At just twenty-four years of age, this remarkable woman has already carved her name into history.

item.title: Message Stick Series 13 Episode 19 In The Frame: Ernie Bridge
item.description: Ernie Bridge was the first Indigenous Australian to be appointed a Cabinet Minister in any Parliament in Australia not only was Ernie a successful politician, he had great achievements in the country music scene.

item.title: Insiders 30/10/11
item.description: Insiders, presented by Barrie Cassidy, is a fast-moving treatment of national affairs with interviews, discussion, and analysis. Each week the program brings together the experience and insights of leading political commentators and other contributors representing a wide range of opinions.

item.title: Insiders 23/10/11
item.description: Insiders, presented by Barrie Cassidy, is a fast-moving treatment of national affairs with interviews, discussion, and analysis. Each week the program brings together the experience and insights of leading political commentators and other contributors representing a wide range of opinions.

item.title: Landline 30/10/11
item.description: On Landline this week the Australian kangaroo industry has renewed hopes that the Russians are coming. We meet one of the pioneers of our home-grown organic movement and we look at cider the fastest growing tipple on the Australian beverage market.

item.title: Landline 23/10/11
item.description: On Landline today with the whole future of live exports under consideration we look at the pros and cons of the sheep trade to the Middle East. The public benefit of private conservation, Bush Heritage Australia takes stock on its 20th anniversary and we're in the thick of the action at another titanic trans-Tasman sporting contest.

item.title: Landline 16/10/11
item.description: On Landline this week the world market for rice is in for an upheaval after Thailand decides to double the price of this food staple. We examine the origins of Australia's natural advantage in wool and join Chinese fashion designers in Tasmania as they get up close and personal with some our finest fleece.

item.title: Landline 09/10/11
item.description: On Landline this week the grain growers fighting a rearguard action against mice, trying to pick winners among all the crops that have been tried in the Top End and the meat chicken industry is challenged about just how much room its chooks have to roam free.

item.title: Offsiders 30/10/11
item.description: A show for anyone who's serious about sport, Offsiders will provide challenging, insightful, humourous debate about the topic that dominates weekends - sport. Each week the program brings together the experience and insights of leading sporting commentators and other contributors representing a wide range of opinions.

item.title: Offsiders 23/10/11
item.description: A show for anyone who's serious about sport, Offsiders will provide challenging, insightful, humourous debate about the topic that dominates weekends - sport. Each week the program brings together the experience and insights of leading sporting commentators and other contributors representing a wide range of opinions.

item.title: Inside Business 30/10/11
item.description: Alan Kohler with analysis and comment on the events and issues concerning business, investors and entrepreneurs.

item.title: Inside Business 23/10/11
item.description: Alan Kohler with analysis and comment on the events and issues concerning business, investors and entrepreneurs.

item.title: Trial And Retribution Tracks
item.description: The body of a young woman is found in a chalk pit, and CCTV evidence points to two local young men. Can DCS Mike Walker and DCI Roisin Connor solve the crime? CAST: David Hayman, Victoria Smurfit

item.title: Trial And Retribution The Box
item.description: While on leave back home in Glasgow, DSC Mike Walker delves into the dark bond between two brothers linked to the disappearance of two women who were once married to the same man. CAST: David Hayman, Kerry Fox

item.title: Penn And Teller: Fool Us Episode 4
item.description: World-famous magicians Penn and Teller get to test a British card magician, a burlesque dancer and magician, and two British illusionists. Can any of them trick our famous duo?

item.title: Penn And Teller: Fool Us Episode 3
item.description: The acts performing for Penn and Teller are: Piff The Magic Dragon - British illusionist; Soma - Hungarian close-up magician; Alan Hudson - British close-up magician; and Damien O'Brien - British street magician.

item.title: Poirot Murder In Mesopotamia
item.description: When Poirot is on holiday in Iraq, the wife of an American archaeologist is murdered. Poirot must do his own digging to find the killer. CAST: David Suchet

item.title: Poirot Lord Edgware Dies
item.description: When Lord Edgware is murdered, the police suspect his wife, the famous actress Jane Wilkinson may be responsible. But Jane has a water-tight alibi. Poirot must uncover the truth. CAST: John Castle, Helen Grace, David Suchet

item.title: Doc Martin Series 5 Episode 3
item.description: Sleepless nights take their toll on Martin and Louise, with their constantly wailing baby. Aunt Ruth has problems with a neighbour stealing hubcaps from her car and the new receptionist gets off to a bad start. CAST: Martin Clunes

item.title: Doc Martin Series 5 Episode 2
item.description: After Dr Dibbs leaves, Dr Ellingham moves back into the surgery until a replacement can be found. He also asks Louisa to move into his house so he can help to raise their child. CAST Martin Clunes, Caroline Catz

item.title: Gardening Australia Series 22 Episode 38
item.description: Clarence Slockee visits the Towra Team, a group of indigenous trainees working with NSW Parks to restore, protect and connect with their country; Sophie Thomson explores The Adelaide Botanic Gardens; and more!

item.title: Gardening Australia Series 22 Episode 37
item.description: Jane Edmanson visits a hospital garden in Alice Springs that provides Indigenous patients with traditional bush medicines; John Patrick visits a garden designed for a large family who love to play outdoors; and more!

item.title: Bowls: Australia v RSA 2011 Bowls: Australia Vs RSA 2011 Women's Triples (1st Test)
item.description: Coverage of all the action when Australia take on South Africa at the Moonta Bowls Club on South Australia's copper coast.

item.title: Basketball: WNBL 2011 Round 4 : Dandenong Vs Bulleen
item.description: Catch all the live (AEDT) action from the Women's National Basketball League as the Dandenong Rangers take on the Bulleen Boomers.

item.title: Basketball: WNBL 2011 Round 3 : Sydney Uni Vs Logan
item.description: Coverage of the 2010/2011 Women's National Basketball League.

item.title: The Queen's Farewell Barbecue
item.description: Live: The Queens Farewell Barbecue will be hosted by ABC TVs Stephanie Brantz. Coverage will begin with The Queens motorcade from Government House along the Perth waterfront. The Premier of Western Australia, Hon Colin Barnett MLA, will give a welcome address followed by remarks from the Queen.

item.title: The Queen's Visit
item.description: In addition to the telecast of Live: The Queens Farewell Barbecue, ABC1 will also screen a highlights package celebrating The Queens current tour of Australia.

item.title: Tracey Ullman's State Of The Union Episode 5 (Final)
item.description: Written by and starring Emmy Award-winner Tracey Ullman, State of the Union is a collection of irreverent and hilarious skits that range from sardonic parody and social satire to Bollywood musicals.

item.title: Tracey Ullman's State Of The Union Episode 4
item.description: Written by and starring Emmy Award-winner Tracey Ullman, State of the Union is a collection of irreverent and hilarious skits that range from sardonic parody and social satire to Bollywood musicals.

item.title: The Jonathan Ross Show Episode 8
item.description: Jonathan Ross welcomes comedy writer and actress, Miranda Hart; musician and singer-songwriter, Noel Gallagher; and actor, Michael Sheen.

item.title: The Jonathan Ross Show Episode 7
item.description: Jonathan Ross welcomes English comedian and actor, David Walliams; Canadian actor, Seth Rogen; singing sensation, Michael Buble; and successful British band, Coldplay.

item.title: My Family Series 10 Episode 4
item.description: A young Australian backpacker catches Janey's eye, but is Ben's chip just on his shoulder or off the old block? CAST: Zo Wanamaker, Robert Linsay

item.title: My Family Series 10 Episode 5
item.description: Ben goes clubbing with his recently 'out' son Michael, but soon finds himself more than slightly out of his depth. CAST: Zo Wanamaker, Robert Linsay

item.title: Scott And Bailey Episode 6 (Final)
item.description: Rachel is living with Nick, but Janet feels he is using her to stop her from reporting his malpractice and, after Rachel is the victim of a dodgy hit-and-run, she tells Gill everything. CAST: Lesley Sharpe, Suranne Jones

item.title: Scott And Bailey Episode 5
item.description: Rachel discovers Nick had an affair with a juror during a case where his client was acquitted, and Janet comes face to face with the killer of her school friend. CAST: Suranne Jones, Lesley Sharp

item.title: Simon Hopkinson: The Good Cook Episode 3
item.description: With useful tips and tricks of the trade Simon Hopkinson demonstrates how to make stuffed roasted peppers, the perfect steak and chips, roasted aubergines with feta, a smoked haddock pilaf and a scrumptious rhubarb crumble.

item.title: Simon Hopkinson: The Good Cook Episode 2
item.description: Simon Hopkinson demonstrates how to make the ultimate 'naked risotto', delicious Parma ham and asparagus pancakes, a quiche Lorraine and a very simple but amazing coffee granita.

item.title: Choccywoccydoodah Episode 3 I Put a Spell on You
item.description: It is Halloween and the time when the chocolate geniuses unleash their eccentricity and create wondrous and terrifying masterpieces, including an extravagant gothic horror cake to be delivered to rock god Alice Cooper.

item.title: Choccywoccydoodah Episode 2 Make Cake And Influence People
item.description: Chief cake artist Dave and his ambitious assistant Tom go into battle to come up with two new chocolate cakes for tough boss Christine.

item.title: Agatha Christie: Poirot Series 3 Episode 4 Appointment With Death (Final)
item.description: Poirot is drawn to an archaeological expedition led by Lord Boynton, but events are overtaken by the discovery of Lady Boynton's dead body and revelations about her fortune. CAST: Tim Curry, David Suchet.

item.title: Midnight Man Episode 2 (Final)
item.description: Disgraced journalist Max Raban is joined by Alice in his quest to prove the existence of 'God's Fist' the government-backed death squad. CAST: James Nesbitt, Catherine McCormack, Rupert Graves

item.title: Artscape 2011 Tracey Emin in Conversation with Virginia Trivoli
item.description: Virginia Trioli talks to Tracey Emin one of the leaders of the Young British Artists better known as the YBAs, the contemporary movement supported and collected by Charles Saatchi.

item.title: The Art Of Chopin
item.description: A tribute to the art of Chopin (1810-1849), to his unique and inimitable writing, which prepared the ground for 20th century music and the modern piano.

item.title: Iron Curtain: Ribbon of Life
item.description: The Iron Curtain that divided communist Eastern Europe from the capitalist West had created a no-man's-land protected by barbed wire and minefields - a last haven for many rare animals and plants.
